Freeciv 3.0.91-dev unit types help (MP2 Elephant)

Founders

Cost: 50 shields
Upkeep: 1 Food, 1 Shield
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.24 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 25
Obsolete by: None
At game start, Founders represent your pre-civilized nomadic tribe.

Founders are Settlers who found size 2 cities. You start the game with Founders. They cannot be built. A Founder can build roads and irrigation in one turn, but be careful not to dallyÔºöa delayed founding is still a delayed growth of the city! Founders see a little farther than other units, and cannot be bribed.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ Start unit: can't be built.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, and Naval Base on tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Pollution from tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Fallout from tiles.
‚û§ Can Build City
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Founders.
  ‚Ä¢ initial population: 2.
‚û§ Can Add to City
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Founders.
  ‚Ä¢ max target size: 39.
  ‚Ä¢ adds 1 population.
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Road
‚û§ Can Build Bases
  ‚Ä¢ Can't make Airbase or Buoy.
‚û§ Can Mine and make Oil Well
‚û§ Can Irrigate
‚û§ Expellable: can be expelled from foreign tiles.
‚û§ Can't be bribed.
‚û§ Can never become veteran.

Settlers

Cost: 40 shields
Upkeep: 1 Food, 1 Shield
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Population Cost: 1. Adds Population: 1.

Settlers are your only means of founding new cities.
Settlers can perform most of the terrain alterations as Workers (but cannot build Airbases or Buoys).
Upkeep for Settlers costs food as well as production. A Settler can die if its supporting city runs out of food. Settlers in a Republic, Democracy, or Theocratic nation require twice as much food per turn. For the first five turns, each Settler will produce +1 bulb of science output.

‚û§ Costs 1 population to build.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, and Naval Base on tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Pollution from tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Fallout from tiles.

  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Settlers.

Tribesmen

Cost: 20 shields
Upkeep: 0
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 8
Obsolete by: None
Tribesmen came before cities and specialized division of labor. During ancient times, they get primitive versatility bonuses:
Tribesmen can explore, moving over terrain with no penalty. They don‚Äôt obey or exert ZOC. They can build roads, quays, irrigate, or mine at half the rate of Workers.
Tribesmen can make basic diplomatic contact and freely Investigate cities. They can carry Goods and enter nations with whom you are at Peace; cargo is visible to everyone. They can do primitive combat‚Äîthey can‚Äôt conquer cities and only attack for 10 combat rounds.
Tribesmen help build nations by recycling into city production with a 2√ó bonus, donating their life-work of 20 shields into any output EXCEPT units. ** Changing production targets loses their work! **
Tribesmen lose many versatility bonuses as you become more civilized. For 3 turns they gain +‚Öì move. After 20 turns, they lose another ‚Öì move and lose their vision, tile-work, and recycle bonuses. At such point, recycling into a building or wonder yields 10 shields.
(In games with animals set to on, Tribesmen attack at 3√ó and defend at 2√ó against wild animals.)

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.
‚û§ A Start Unit only: may not be built in cities.
‚û§ Can carry 1 Goods unit.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo not visible except to allies.
‚û§ Can build infrastructure until T20 (2000BC).
  ‚Ä¢ Can Road, 2 turns. (4-6 turns for slower roaded terrain.)
  ‚Ä¢ Can Mine, 10 turns.
  ‚Ä¢ Can Irrigate, 5 turns.
‚û§ Ignores terrain effects (moving costs at most ‚Öì MP per tile).
  ‚Ä¢ Stepping off/onto an enemy river does not incur movement penalty.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Can Attack
  ‚Ä¢ Combat ensues for 10 combat rounds.
  ‚Ä¢ May or may not result in a victor.
  ‚Ä¢ 3√ó Attack and 2√ó Defense bonus vs. Animals.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Can't conquer cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can Investigate City (does not spend the unit)
‚û§ Can Recycle
  ‚Ä¢ Must be done in a domestic city making a Building, Wonder, or Coinage.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses up the Tribesmen.
  ‚Ä¢ Contributes 20 shields to current production until T20 (2000BC)
  ‚Ä¢ Contributes 10 shields to current production after T20 (2000BC)
  ‚Ä¢ Recycled shields are 100% lost if production target is changed.
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Capturable: can be captured if conditions allow it.
‚û§ Expellable: can be expelled from foreign tiles.
‚û§ Loses vision after T20 (2000BC).
‚û§ Loses ‚Öì move after T20 (2000BC).
‚û§ Unable to pillage tiles.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans gain fractonal move-points per veteran level.

Peasants

Cost: 10 shields
Upkeep: 0
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: None
Population Cost: 1. Adds Population: 1.

Peasants are the common people of Monarchies. You can encourage them by royal edict to migrate to other cities and help colonize new areas. But to have such access, you must be a Constitutional Monarchy with the Magna Carta wonderÔºö Peasants can only be made in the city with Magna Carta, so choose that city carefully.
If managed correctly, Peasants can increase your national population growth. They give a tremendous advantage for growing new colonies and settlements faster.
Peasants can only be made in one city, but you can make more than one per turn under the right conditions. When a city completes a unit, it will try to make more of them if it doesn‚Äôt have a worklist. So be careful!

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Can only be built with Constitutional Monarchy as government.
‚û§ Can only be built if there is Magna Carta in the city.
‚û§ Costs 1 population to build.
‚û§ May load onto and unload from Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can Add to City
  ‚Ä¢ is done to domestic individual cities.
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Pilgrims.
  ‚Ä¢ max target size: 39.
  ‚Ä¢ adds 1 population.
‚û§ Capturable: can be captured if conditions allow it.
‚û§ Expellable: can be expelled from foreign tiles.
‚û§ Unable to pillage tiles.
‚û§ Can never become veteran.

Pilgrims

Cost: 10 shields
Upkeep: 2 Food
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: None
Population Cost: 0. Adds Population: 1.

Pilgrims are wayfaring migrants from Theocratic nations. Like Zealots, they have no upkeep if under a Theocratic government. Heeding the call of ecclesiastic authority, Pilgrims can be guided from one city to another in order to transfer population from city to city. Pilgrims have no population cost, so can be thought of as geographically controlled rapture for the price of 10 shields.

Pilgrims can Establish Home City in any allied city that is Theocracy, allowing control to pass between nations who share the same faith.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Can only be built with Theocracy as government.
‚û§ Costs no population to build (0).
‚û§ May load onto and disembark from Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can Add to City
  ‚Ä¢ is done to domestic individual cities.
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Pilgrims.
  ‚Ä¢ max target size: 39.
  ‚Ä¢ adds 1 population.

Proletarians

Cost: 10 shields
Upkeep: 1 Food
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: None
Population Cost: 1. Adds Population: 2.

Proletarians can only be controlled by Communist governments.
Communist States can assign Proletarians from one city to another, which transfers population from one to the other. They can also be ordered to the same tasks as Workers. Proletarians are extremely valuable as Workers for a third of the price. The disadvantage is that they cost one population to make. However, this is compensated by the fact that when they join a city, they add two to the population!
Large numbers of Proletarians can be used to rapidly complete important State projects, which you may organize into Five-turn Plans.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.

  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.

  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Can only be built with Communism as government.
‚û§ Controllable only by Communist governments.
‚û§ Costs 1 population to build.
‚û§ May load onto and disembark from Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, Naval Base, Airbase, Radar, and Buoy on tiles.

‚û§ Can clean Fallout from tiles.

Migrants

Cost: 10 shields
Upkeep: 2 Food
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: None
Population Cost: 1. Adds Population: 1.

Migrants are citizens under Nationalist governments who are encouraged to settle in new cities, often in conquered or colonial areas. They can be guided from one city to another in order to transfer population from city to city. If managed correctly, they can increase the overall rate of national population growth.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

Workers

Cost: 30 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 8
Obsolete by: Workers II
Workers can improve terrain tiles. See the manual on Terrain for details. 
Masonry lets Workers build Forts. Construction lets them build Fortresses and Oil Wells. Engineering lets them build Canals and Naval Bases.
Feudalism with Construction lets them build Castles. Steel lets them build Bunkers and Sea Bridges. Radio lets them build Airbases and Buoys, which Settlers cannot. Workers must be on a ship to build Buoys. 
Communism tech allows Communist governments to conscript Workers into Riflemen via the Convert order. And vice versa.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Under Communism, may be obtained by conversion of Riflemen.
‚û§ May load onto and disembark from Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, Naval Base, Airbase, Radar, and Buoy on tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Pollution from tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Fallout from tiles.
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Engineers.
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Road
‚û§ Can Convert Unit
  ‚Ä¢ is converted into Riflemen (takes 2 MP).
‚û§ Can Build Bases
‚û§ Can Mine and make Oil Well
‚û§ Can Irrigate
‚û§ Capturable: can be captured if conditions allow it.
‚û§ Expellable: can be expelled from foreign tiles.
‚û§ May not acquire veteran status.
‚û§ May retain veteran status after conversion.

Workers II

Cost: 30 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 8
Obsolete by: Engineers
As civilization progresses, socioeconomic trends improve education, efficiency and methodsÔºö for each turn of work completed, Workers II gain a small chance of promotion.
‚Ä¢ v1 do 6 turns of work in 5 turns (Journeyman);
‚Ä¢ v2 do 5 turns of work in 4 turns (Foreman);
‚Ä¢ v3 do 4 turns of work in 3 turns (Master Workman).
These bonuses stack with other work rate bonuses. A small movement bonus also increases efficiency, as they can step onto nearby rough terrain without losing all moves.

In other respects, this unit is identical to Workers I.
Masonry lets Workers build Forts. Construction lets them build Fortresses and Oil Wells. Engineering lets them build Canals and Naval Bases. Feudalism with Construction lets them build Castles. Steel lets them build Bunkers and Sea Bridges. Radio lets them build Airbases and Buoys, which Settlers cannot. Workers must be on a ship to build Buoys.
Workers are immediately upgraded to Workers II when you learn Democracy. Until the discovery of Explosives, you can upgrade bribed and captured Workers for free. This can be done on any tile and the current job is not interrupted.
Communism tech allows Communist governments to conscript Workers II into Riflemen via the Convert order. And vice versa.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Under Communism, may be obtained by conversion of Riflemen.
‚û§ May load onto and disembark from Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, Naval Base, Airbase, Radar, and Buoy on tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Pollution from tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Fallout from tiles.
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Engineers.
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Road
‚û§ Can Convert Unit
  ‚Ä¢ is converted into Riflemen (takes 2 MP).
‚û§ Can Build Bases
‚û§ Can Mine and make Oil Well
‚û§ Can Irrigate
‚û§ Capturable: can be captured if conditions allow it.
‚û§ Expellable: can be expelled from foreign tiles.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
‚û§ Veteran bonuses stack with other work rate bonuses.

Engineers

Cost: 40 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 4
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 2
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Engineers can do everything Workers can do, at twice the speed. Unlike Workers, Engineers can Transform, such as converting Desert to Plains. Converting Ocean to Swamp requires being on a ship on a tile bordering 2 land tiles. Constructing a Sea Bridge requires being on a ship on a tile cardinally adjacent to land.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, Naval Base, Airbase, Radar, and Buoy on tiles.
‚û§ Can clean Pollution from tiles.

Warriors

Cost: 8 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Pikemen
The Warrior is the weakest foot soldier, but can also be very cost effective.

With the discovery of Conscription, Warriors can convert to Musketeers in any domestic city.

The discovery of Banking changes upkeep from shields to gold.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ The discovery of Banking converts the shield upkeep of this unit to 1 gold upkeep.
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Pikemen or, when possible, to the unit type it upgrades to.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Can Make Hideout
  ‚Ä¢ Requires Forest, Jungle, Swamp, or Mountains. Land units will be invisible.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.

Phalanx

Cost: 16 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 2
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Pikemen
The Phalanx is armored infantry, excellent for defensively holding tactical positionsÔºöa Phalanx gets a 50% attack bonus if it has not moved. Phalanxes can also do standard attacks and Rumble attacks and remain fortified after the attack!

If a Phalanx hasn‚Äôt moved, it can Rumble Attack adjacent enemies. Rumbles are disciplined skirmish‚Äînot mortal combat. The formation gives the Phalanx little or no vulnerability. The trade-off is that the Phalanx can only thrust at a single target for 3 combat rounds. Rumble attacks are used to unsettle enemies: they can discourage fortifying into tactical positions, or weaken them prior to attacks from other units. The action uses 6‚ÅÑ10 of a move point and doesn‚Äôt alter the fortified status of the Phalanx.

With the discovery of Conscription, Phalanxes can convert to Musketeers in any domestic city. The discovery of Banking changes upkeep from shields to gold.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.
‚û§ Can safely conduct Rumble Attack. (Ranged Attack)
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 3 free rounds of combat on 1 unit in an enemy stack.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 5⁄9 movement points.
  ‚Ä¢ Action requires:
    - a minimum of 1 move point
    - Phalanx to already be Fortified and/or to have used no moves this turn.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot do this action while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ No unit can be killed.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot be done to Cities, Forts, Fortresses, Naval Bases, nor Oceanic tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Can do action while fortified and remain fortified afterwards.
‚û§ Can attack while fortified and remain fortified afterwards.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ The discovery of Banking converts the shield upkeep of this unit to 1 gold upkeep.
‚û§ Can Expel
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Pikemen or, when possible, to the unit type it upgrades to.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage

Archers

Cost: 24 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 3
Defense: 2
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Musketeers
Archers fight with bows and arrows. They have good offense and decent defense. Rather than fight to the death, Archers can also do a ranged Volley Attack which avoids hand-to-hand retaliation: two volleys of arrows are fired on up to 3 enemy units on the tile, causing 1-2hp of damage to any units who are hit. This includes Oceanic tiles if not transported. This is useful for softening enemies prior to battle, or for deterring an approach to a strategic location. (Volley Attack is not possible on Cities or Fortresses.) Archers can do a retaliatory Volley attack against any unit which does a Special Unit Attack on them.

With the discovery of Conscription, Archers can convert to Musketeers in any domestic city.

The discovery of Banking changes upkeep from shields to gold.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.
‚û§ Can safely conduct Volley Attacks. (Ranged Attack)
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 2 free rounds of combat on up to 7 units in an enemy stack.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 15⁄9 movement points.
  ‚Ä¢ Can Volley Attack adjacent Land tiles even while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ Can Volley Attack adjacent Oceanic tiles from a Land tile, but not while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ No unit can be killed.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot be done to Cities, Fortresses, nor Naval Bases.
  ‚Ä¢ Can do action while fortified and remain fortified afterwards.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ Has Special Defense against Special Attacks / Ranged Attacks.
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 2 free rounds of combat against up to 7 units in an enemy stack.
‚û§ The discovery of Banking converts the shield upkeep of this unit to 1 gold upkeep.
‚û§ Can Capture Unit
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone, not on Mountains, and not in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Expel
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Musketeers or, when possible, to the unit type it upgrades to.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Can Make Hideout

Legion

Cost: 30 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 4
Defense: 2
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Musketeers
Legions are heavily armed well disciplined soldiers with excellent offensive strength. They are famous for their engineering abilities: with the required technology they can build Forts and Fortresses. They can build Roads outside domestic national territory and inside Forts and Fortresses.
Legions are feared for how they start battle: a Pilum Assault targets the shields of the enemy. A pilum stuck in a shield renders it useless, leaving the front line vulnerable to a full-on charge. The Pilum Assault does 1 round of combat at 2√ó attack bonus on up to 2 units on the tile.

With the discovery of Conscription, Legions can convert to Musketeers in any domestic city.

The discovery of Banking changes upkeep from shields to gold.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.
‚û§ Can safely conduct Pilum Assault. (Ranged Attack)
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 1 free round of combat on up to 2 units in an enemy stack.
  ‚Ä¢ Attack odds receive a 2√ó bonus.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 1 movement point.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot do this action while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ 2 defending units can potentially be killed.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot be done to Cities, Forts, Fortresses, Naval Bases, nor Oceanic tiles.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ Can build Quay, Road, Railroad, Maglev, Canal, and Waterway on tiles.
‚û§ Can build Fort, Fortress, and Naval Base on tiles.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ The discovery of Banking converts the shield upkeep of this unit to 1 gold upkeep.
‚û§ Can Capture Unit
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone, not on Mountains, and not in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Expel
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Musketeers or, when possible, to the unit type it upgrades to.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Can Road
  ‚Ä¢ must be done on a non-domestic tile or in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
‚û§ Can Build Bases

‚û§ Can Make Hideout

Pikemen

Cost: 18 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 2
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Musketeers
Long sharp pikes give Pikemen a counter to the height and mobility of mounted units. Pikemen get a 50% attack bonus if they have not moved, and enjoy a 2√ó defense bonus against mounted units. Pikemen replace the Phalanx as the preferred city defender.

With the discovery of Conscription, Pikemen can convert to Musketeers in any domestic city.
The discovery of Banking changes upkeep from shields to gold.

Falconeers

Cost: 20 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 2 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 1
Firepower: 20
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Zealots
Falconeers are Theocratic holy warriors armed with Falconets‚Äîthe largest hand cannons humans can carry. Ottoman Janissaries, Reconquistadores, Persian Safavid, and Indian Mughal used them to prove whose side God is on.
Falconets are huge and heavy. They have woeful accuracy but lethal firepowerÔºöthey either kill or totally miss. On paper, attack odds are closest to a Musketeer (A3). Yet there is a high chance of losing when a win is expected, or winning when a loss is expected. The outcome is in God's hands! Falconeers defend a bit worse than they attack.
Righteous faith is needed to fight with slow heavy inaccurate weaponry: only Theocracies can train Falconeers. Other governments will incur high upkeep or see them retire.

  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile

  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.

Musketeers are infantry equipped with early firearms. They replace Pikemen as the preferred city defender, and replace Archers and Legions for offensive foot soldiers. The discovery of Mechanization allows converting Musketeers to Riflemen for free in any domestic city.

The discovery of Banking changes upkeep from shields to gold.

Partisan

Cost: 40 shields
Upkeep: 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 4
Defense: 4
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Partisans are guerilla fighters who can use the terrain to their advantage. Like the Scout that they upgrade, they can slip through ZOC and live off the land with no upkeep. Partisans provide sentry intel even if not sentried. Partisans can investigate conquered cities not owned by the original owner.

Proportional to city size, up to 8 Partisans appear when an enemy conquers your city. They randomly fortify on any tile inside the circle defined by its workable radius. Partisans prefer defensive tiles, and ignore tile nationality. They spawn only when:
‚û£ Guerilla Warfare is known by any player.
‚û£ The city was originally built by you.
‚û£ The city hasn‚Äôt spawned twice and it has been 2 turns since last spawning.
‚û£ The conquest is not a ‚Äúfalse flag attack‚Äù made by a cooperating player.
‚û£ You must be Democracy or Communist, AND know Communism AND Gunpowder, OR
‚û£ You must be Theocracy, in which case the "partisan spawn" will yield Zealots or Fanatics.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.
‚û§ Never has a home city.
‚û§ Reconnaissance: reports visible enemy movement even if not sentried.
‚û§ Ignores terrain effects (moving costs at most ‚Öì MP per tile).
  ‚Ä¢ Stepping off/onto an enemy river does not incur movement penalty.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ May load onto and disembark from Trains or Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can Capture Unit
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone, not on Mountains, and not in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Expel
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Can Make Hideout
  ‚Ä¢ Requires Forest, Jungle, Swamp, or Mountains. Land units will be invisible.
‚û§ No Home City: not susceptible to upkeep nor disbanding.
‚û§ Can Sentry Always
  ‚Ä¢ Provides sentry intel of foreign unit movements even when not sentried.

  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.

Riflemen

Cost: 35 shields
Upkeep: 1 Gold, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 5
Defense: 4
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Ground Troops
Riflemen are World War-era infantry. They are good at defending cities and strategic Fortresses. They also have good attack capability.

Under Communism this unit costs 5 less. Also, Communism tech allows Communist governments to de-commission Riflemen into Workers II via the Convert order. And vice versa.

Zealots

Cost: 20 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 2 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 4
Defense: 4
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Zealots are warriors devoted to a higher cause. Their faith is strong and they cannot be bribed.
Theocratic nations can maintain Zealots without paying their steep upkeep. (Zealots are unhappy if not under Theocracy, requiring high upkeep to stay content.) Zealots produced in a city with Ecclesiastical Palace are inspired by fervorous faith to +1 higher veteran level.
Zealots fervently defend their homeland, and can do surprise skirmish assaults to snipe and injure foreign occupants: Up to 4 invaders on the tile will endure three combat rounds without defense. Skirmish assaults can also be done to foreign occupied cities if they have a remaining Foreign National population.
Zealots can Establish Home City in any allied city that is Theocracy, allowing control to pass between nations who share the same faith.

Moves: 2

Attack: 5

Alpine Troops are highly mobile units and excellent defenders.  Similar to a Scout, they treat every land tile like a road were on it.

With Combined Arms, Alpine Troops get +2 to combat strength.

  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ requires Combined Arms and is automatic and free.
  ‚Ä¢ upgrade cost for bribed Alpine Troops is 4 gold.
  ‚Ä¢ receives +2 in combat stength from the upgrade.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Can Make Hideout
  ‚Ä¢ Requires Forest, Jungle, Swamp, or Mountains. Land units will be invisible.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.

Marines

Cost: 50 shields
Upkeep: 1 Gold, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.83 tiles
Attack: 8
Defense: 5
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Marines are experts at all-terrain warfare. Armed with diverse weaponry, they are the strongest foot unit in the game. Marines have special abilities. They canÔºö
  ‚ñ™ Be transported without losing moves.
  ‚ñ™ Attack Sea units (at a 50% penalty).
  ‚ñ™ Attack while fortified and maintain fortified status.
  ‚ñ™ Attack from a Transport or Helicopter.
  ‚ñ™ Attack reachable targets on a tile without being blocked by Fighters.
  ‚ñ™ Do Bazooka attacks, if vet-2Ôºö 3 rounds on 2 units, max. 1 kill.
  ‚ñ™ Do Bazooka attacks on ocean tiles, if not transported.
  ‚ñ™ Disembark from non-native tiles using only 1 move point.
  ‚ñ™ (De)board and (un)load without using or needing move points.
  ‚ñ™ Step on/off enemy Rivers without extra move penalties.
  ‚ñ™ Make Forts and Airbases.

Marines gain greater strength bonuses with veterancy, and get more move points for each veteran level. Marines built in a city with an Airport, Port Facility, and Barracks III receive an extra veteran level.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Belongs to LandAirSea unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can attack from Ships and Helicopters.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can attack ocean tiles, even while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ Can attack from ocean tiles, while transported.
‚û§ Unblockable: unreachable units can't block its attacks on reachable units.
‚û§ Can safely conduct Bazooka Attacks. (Ranged Attack)
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 3 free rounds of combat against up to 2 units in an enemy stack.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 15⁄9 movement points.
  ‚Ä¢ Unit must be Veteran-level 2 (Hardened) or higher.
  ‚Ä¢ Can Bazooka Attack adjacent Land tiles even while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ Can Bazooka Attack adjacent Oceanic tiles from a Land tile, but not while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot be done to a City, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ A maximum of 1 unit can be killed.
  ‚Ä¢ Can do action while fortified and remain fortified afterwards.
‚û§ Can attack while fortified and remain fortified afterwards.
‚û§ Can attack reachable units on ocean tiles.
‚û§ May load and unload from Trains and Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ Loses only 1 move point when disembarking from non-native terrain to native terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Native disembark uses terrain move cost.
‚û§ Can cross enemy rivers without extra penalties.
  ‚Ä¢ Stepping off/onto an enemy river does not incur movement penalty.
‚û§ Transport Board and Transport Deboard do not use or need move points.
  ‚Ä¢ The same is true when the AAA is the affected cargo of Transport Load, Transport Unload.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Can attack against Sea units, which are usually not reachable.
  ‚Ä¢ attacks at a -50% penalty.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can Capture Unit
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone, not on Mountains, and not in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Expel
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Can Build Bases
  ‚Ä¢ can build Fort and Airbase.
  ‚Ä¢ cannot build Fortress, Naval Base, Castle, Bunker, Radar, or Buoy.
  ‚Ä¢ veteran work rates apply.
‚û§ Can Make Hideout
  ‚Ä¢ Requires Forest, Jungle, Swamp, or Mountains. Land units will be invisible.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.

Fanatics

Cost: 25 shields
Upkeep: 1 Gold, 2 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 6
Defense: 5
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Fanatics are modern warriors devoted to a higher cause. They cannot be bribed. 
Theocratic nations can maintain Fanatics without paying their steep upkeep. (Fanatics are unhappy if not under Theocracy, requiring high upkeep to stay content.) Fanatics produced in a city with Ecclesiastical Palace are inspired by fervorous faith to +1 higher veteran level.

Fanatics fervently defend their homeland, and can do surprise skirmish assaults to snipe and injure foreign occupantsÔºöUp to 4 invaders on the tile will endure three combat rounds without defense. Skirmish assaults can also be done to foreign occupied cities if they have a remaining Foreign National population.

Fanatics can Establish Home City in any allied city that is Theocracy, allowing control to pass between nations who share the same faith.

Zealots upgrade to Fanatics for free with the required tech.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

‚û§ Can only be built with Theocracy as government.

  ‚Ä¢ Gives 3 free rounds of combat against up to 4 units in an enemy stack.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 15⁄9 movement points.
  ‚Ä¢ Can do this action while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ Must be inside domestic territory OR attacking a City with foreign nationals.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot be done to Fortresses, Naval Bases, or Oceanic Tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ No unit can be killed.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ May load onto and disembark from Trains or Transport Helicopters even when underway.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can Capture Unit
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone, not on Mountains, and not in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Can Expel
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone and not on Mountains.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can Pillage

Paratroopers

Cost: 55 shields
Upkeep: 1 Gold, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 6
Defense: 4
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Paratroopers are expert at airborne deployment and attacks. Paratroopers have multiple ways to parachute to distant tilesÔºö
  ‚Ä¢ Move a Cargo Plane over the the desired tile, then Deboard Transport (shift-T), or Unload Transport (T). ‚Ä°
  ‚Ä¢ Without a Cargo Plane, Paratroopers can Paradrop (P) within 5 tiles range, if in a friendly city or airbase. Fighters on Vigil may auto-attack the adjacent tile you land on.

Paratroopers can Board and Deboard any transport for free. If on a Cargo Plane, they are similar to Marines and AAA, incurring no passenger move costs. They can defend their transport from attackers.

‚Ä° Paratroopers may also disembark from a Cargo Plane to an adjacent tile (uses all moves.)

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

  ‚Ä¢ must have moves left
  ‚Ä¢ must not have not paradropped this turn
  ‚Ä¢ airport not required in city
  ‚Ä¢ maximum range:  5 tiles.
‚û§ Can Board and Deboard any transport with no move cost.
‚û§ Can be dropped to any tile from Cargo Planes.
  ‚Ä¢ Move cost is 0, if onto the same tile.
  ‚Ä¢ Move cost is all move points, if onto an adjacent tile.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.

‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Can defend while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ May defend Cargo Plane from attacks while transported.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can Capture Unit
  ‚Ä¢ target unit must be alone, not on Mountains, and not in a Fort, Fortress, or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ uses ‚Öî movement point
  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile

  ‚Ä¢ actor stays on its own tile

Scout

Cost: 18 shields
Upkeep: 0
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.24 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Scout II
Scouts are explorers of unknown territory. They live off the land with no upkeep. They can slip through ZOC. They ignore terrain penalties, treating every tile as if it had a road. They can move 4 tiles per turn (6 after discovering Map Making.) Veterancy may provide additional move points. Scouts can Investigate City to gather intel, and their terrain scouting can give tactical advantage. Scouts can make contact with far-off lands to arrange Cease-fire or Peace. In later times, Scouts upgrade to Scout II.

Scouts provide sentry intel even if not sentried. Scouts gain the same veteran levels from buildings and wonders as other land units.

‚û§ Belongs to Land unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ Ignores terrain effects (moving costs at most ‚Öì MP per tile).
  ‚Ä¢ Stepping off/onto an enemy river does not incur movement penalty.
‚û§ Map Making gives +2/3 moves, giving a range of +2 tiles.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Reconnaissance: reports visible enemy movement even if not sentried.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack
‚û§ Can Investigate City (does not spend the unit)
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Partisan.
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.
  ‚Ä¢ Gets the 50% defensive bonus automatically while in cities.
‚û§ Capturable: can be captured if conditions allow it.
‚û§ Expellable: can be expelled from foreign tiles.
‚û§ No Home City: not susceptible to upkeep nor disbanding.
‚û§ Can Sentry Always
  ‚Ä¢ Provides sentry intel of foreign unit movements even when not sentried.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
  ‚Ä¢ Can get veteran status when built, from Barracks and wonders.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.

Scout II upgrades the Scout, and gets every bonus and ability its predecessor does. It gains 2 new abilities. It may pillage and engage in light combat. Whether attacking or defending, there are 15 combat rounds. This may result in no fatalities. They cannot conquer cities. In later times, Scout II upgrades to Partisans.

Forts and Fortresses gain no bonus against its ability to blast and break through fortifications. ECM and composite armor give a 75% defense bonus against Missiles. Unlike most land units, Armor II can attack reachable units regardless of whether unreachable units protect the tile.

Catapult

Cost: 34 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 6
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Cannon
Catapults are rock-throwing war machines. Massive stones diminish the defense bonus of City Walls by -25%, down to 1.75√ó.

If they haven't moved, Catapults can do 4 rounds of Bombardment on a single unit, which may possibly be killed. When special attacked from range or rammed in a Fortress, they can retaliate with the same type of Bombardment.

Catapults are weak defenders, and need an escort to be effective.

VIGILÔºöthe Vigil order lets Catapults auto-Bombard adjacent military units if they have better attack odds. Can be done in cities or bases if it has used no moves.

Siege Ram

Cost: 45 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Cannon
Siege Rams launch a tremendous thrusting force through iron-capped timber shafts. They can break through City Walls if they are not killed first. City Walls have counter defenses, giving Siege Rams even odds of success. Wall defense in capitals is twice as stiff‚Äîcutting odds to 25%.

Siege Rams may also ram Fortresses and Naval Bases, doing up to 4hp of damage on each occupant. This emulates damage to the Fortress defense bonus, which is partly or fully repaired/recovered next turn.

Siege Rams can only travel by road. They can carry 1 Land unit as cargo: their slow pace means this serves more for disguise or defense.

Siege Rams need an escort for protection. They need a minimum of 1 move point to attack a Fortress or City Walls. Cities protected by the Great Wall or Citadel of Aleppo are immune to Siege Rams.

The discovery of Metallurgy by any nation incapacitates Siege Rams.

  ‚Ä¢ Can only travel on roads.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
  ‚Ä¢ Can't attack as Cargo. Must first unload.

  ‚Ä¢ Requires one full remaining move point, at minimum.
‚û§ Can carry and 1 Foot soldier unit.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo not visible except to allies.
‚û§ Can safely conduct Ram Fortress. (Ranged Attack)
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 4 free round of combat on all units in an enemy Fortress or Naval Base.
  ‚Ä¢ Attack odds receive an 8.75√ó bonus.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 1 movement point.
  ‚Ä¢ Action requires a minimum of 11⁄9 move points.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot do this action while transported.
  ‚Ä¢ No defending units can be killed.
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot be done to any tile except a Fortress or Naval Base.
‚û§ RESTRICTED by Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Cannon or, when possible, to the unit type it upgrades to.
‚û§ Can Pillage
‚û§ Can Fortify, granting a 50% defensive bonus when not in a city.

Ballista

Cost: 45 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 2
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 1
Firepower: 5
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Cannon
Ballistae can only do Ranged Attack, firing massive bolts through enemy ranks for 5 rounds. This targets and possibly kills 2 units who can‚Äôt conventionally retaliate, both of which may die. The Ballista‚Äôs A1 5FP is deadlier than an equivalent A5 1FP unit. Unlike other Ballistic class, Ballistae have no requirement to be in a Fort or City: one move point remaining is required to Vigil or Ranged Attack; one move point is spent on the attack. Ballistae can target Ocean tiles but not Fortresses or Cities. 

When conventionally defending against foot and mounted units, Ballistae defend at 1/5 strength. However, on defensive terrain it can still be fatal ‚Äî only 2 successful combat rounds kill most attackers. Attacking ships and Ballistic units face the full D1 5FP‚Äîa deadly deterrent. 

Ballistae excel at degrading forts and well-fortified tiles. They can do Special Unit Defense, retaliating against ranged attacks with lethal force. 

VIGILÔºöthe Vigil order lets Ballistae automatically Range-Attack adjacent military units if they have better attack odds. Vigil can only be done in cities or bases if the Ballista has used no moves.

    - Ballista to have used no moves this turn.

Attack: 2
Defense: 2
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Anti-Aircraft Artillery (AAA) get a 2√ó bonus against Air units. They can attack any tile. They can be transported by any unit that can carry Marines, without losing moves. Transported AAA can defend their tile, even at sea. AAA can‚Äôt attack while transported, and cannot attack Submarines, Missiles, and High Altitude aircraft.

Like Siege class units, AAA can vigil if in a city or base if they have their full move-points left.

After Space Flight and 9 turns of service, AAA can be converted to Mobile SAM. The order must be done in a domestic city, and takes 2 turns.

The Mobile SAM can also carry 3 Missiles of any type. With upgraded Laser tech, each Mobile SAM has a 33% chance to thwart adjacent nuclear bombs dropped by bombers.

Big Land units can‚Äôt enter Mountains without a road or native base.

Balloon

Cost: 25 shields
Upkeep: 0
Moves: 5
Vision: 4.12 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 0
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: None
Balloons gather intel on potential battle areas. They have great vision and are unreachable by units prior to Riflemen and Ironclads. They can stay in the air for one Turn Change before landing in a City, Quay, Base, or transport unit with cargo capacity of 4+. Balloons give sentry reports of nearby unit movements even when not on sentry. Balloons do not block units under them from being attacked, and cannot fly over mountains.

GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

üîπ Multislot: can use additional city build slots.

Zeppelin

Cost: 45 shields
Upkeep: 0
Moves: 7
Vision: 4.90 tiles
Attack: 2
Defense: 1
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
As new technology inspires the upgrade of Balloons, the Zeppelin appears. In theory, it can be used for tactical advantage in combat. However, vulnerability and cost make it better for intel. It can do limited attack with bombs, or 20 combat rounds with medium caliber ordnance. It has 7 turns of fuel so can stay out for many turns before landing in a City, Quay, Fortress, Naval Base, Airbase, or transport with 6+ capacity.
Zeppelins have great vision and are unreachable by units prior to Marines and Destroyers. Zeppelins do not block units under them from being attacked. Zeppelins give sentry reports of nearby unit movements even when not on sentry. Unlike Balloons, they can fly over Mountains.

GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

Fighter

Cost: 60 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 20
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 4
Defense: 3
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Jet Fighter
Fighters are the first offensive Air units. Their superior mobility and firepower alter the very nature of warfare. They can move anywhere and attack any unit except Submarines, Jet Bombers, Spy Planes, and Satellites. Fighters need fuel to avoid crashing and thus must end every turn in a city, Airbase, or Carrier. Air units can't conquer undefended enemy cities. Fighters can attack twice per turn.

INTERCEPTOR: the Vigil order lets Fighters auto-attack adjacent Air units if they have better attack odds. A Fighter with half or more of its moves can Vigil in an airbase, city, on a Carrier type, or if it has used 5 move points or less.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

‚û§ Belongs to AirProtect unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ INTERCEPTOR: can be given the Vigil order to auto-attack adjacent Air units.
    * can be given if unit has 15 or more move points; OR has half or more moves left and is in an airbase, city, carrier type.
  ‚Ä¢ AIR COVER: Most units who cannot attack this unit also cannot attack other units on the tile.
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Unreachable. Most units cannot attack this one.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
‚û§ Can attack a maximum of 2 times per turn.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.

Fighter-types on Vigil will (usually) engage the following units:

* Note: Propeller-type fighters are unable to reach high altitude aircraft (Jet Bomber, Spy Plane.)
Vet levels and hitpoints may alter the decision to engage.

Escort Fighter

Cost: 80 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 18
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 3
Defense: 5
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Multi-Fighter
Escort Fighters are large fighters with high fuel capacity. Higher mass and stronger construction allow them to absorb more damage. They do not attack as well as standard Fighters, but can return home on the next turn. They are good for long-range missions, defensive air support, and escorting bombers. Escort Fighters can attack twice per turn.

INTERCEPTOR: the Vigil order lets Escort Fighters auto-attack adjacent Air units if they have better attack odds. This unit with half or more of its moves can Vigil in an airbase, in a city, on a Carrier type, or if it uses 8 move points or less.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

    * can be given if unit has 10 or more move points; OR has half or more moves left and is in an airbase, city, carrier type.
  ‚Ä¢ AIR COVER: Most units who cannot attack this unit also cannot attack other units on the tile.
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Unreachable. Most units cannot attack this one.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.

‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
‚û§ Can attack a maximum of 2 times per turn.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.
‚û§ STACK ESCAPE: 60% odds to escape if stack defender loses, if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
‚û§ Reconnaissance: reports visible enemy movement even if not sentried.
‚û§ INTERCEPTED by Fighter types on Vigil: they auto-attack if they have better odds attacking than defending.
‚û§ Can attack against Missile units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Air units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against AirProtect units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Unit must be in a City, Airbase, or on a Carrier type after 2 turns.

  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Jet Fighter.

Dive Bomber

Cost: 60 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 18
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 4.5
Defense: 3
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Ground Strike Fighter
Dive Bombers are fitted with armor and armaments for Ground Attack and Sea combat. They do better attacking surface targets and defending vs Anti-Air, but have reduced range and Air-to-Air ability. They do not block attacks on their same tile, but exert ZoC on adjacent land tiles and can iPillage. The Dive Bomber is not an interceptor, and can only attack once per turn. Cargo Plane

Cost: 65 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 26
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 10
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Cargo Planes can carry 5 foot soldiers, diplomatic units, worker-types, or commerce cargo.
Cargo Planes have a variety of uses:
 ‚Ä£ They can airlift cargo to a friendly airport for only 1 airlift point.
 ‚Ä£ They can quickly bring needed troops to a distant city or airbase.
 ‚Ä£ Paratroopers can jump below (T) the Cargo Plane with no move cost.
 ‚Ä£ They can bring Freight to distant cities for commercial or industrial purposes.
 ‚Ä£ Diplomatic missions (a legal landing spot is needed).

A Cargo Plane is delivered free to the capital with discovery of Combined Arms.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

Spy Plane

Cost: 160 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 34
Vision: 6.78 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
The Spy Plane is an ultrasonic high altitude aircraft with long range. It gathers intel over a wide area. Stealth technology makes it invisible, except to enemies on adjacent tiles. Spy Planes have 2 turns of fuel. They are unreachable to primitive propeller-based aircraft. The speed and altitude of the Spy Plane are such that attackers only get 5 combat rounds against this unit.

Satellite

Cost: 140 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 65
Vision: 7.94 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Satellites orbit the Earth above the atmosphere. They are unreachable to anything but missiles. Their orbital velocity allows them to circumnavigate the planet in a couple turns. Telescopic cameras allow them to Investigate City, even if the city has a Police Station. Satellites cannot be seen by others unless adjacent. Satellites require Laser tech, and can only be built in the city with the Apollo Program.

Stack-EscapeÔºö100% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
NOTE:  Due to game mechanics, Satellites block terrestrial movement over a tile. This is solved by killing it with any Missile. To avoid this, end your turn far away from developed or trafficked areas.

Transport Helicopter

Cost: 90 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 12
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 3
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 21
Obsolete by: None
Transport Helicopters can carry three land units, which they can pick up from anywhere
Foot and artillery types can unload by stepping off to any adjacent tile, but will lose all moves (except Marine types). Other types need a City, Airbase, or Naval Base to unload.

Helicopters lose 1 hp for each turn not ended in a City, Base, or Carrier. +1 move is awarded if starting a turn in a City or Airbase. Whether resting or not, all Helicopter types regain 10hp if turn-change is spent in a city.

All Helicopters can be attacked by land from Riflemen onward; by sea from Ironclad onward; get +50% defence vs. foot units; and are unreachable to artillery types. Unlike attack Helicopters, Transport Helicopters are intercepted by Fighters on vigil. Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.

‚û§ Loses 1hp for every turn in the air.

Helicopter

Cost: 95 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 12
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 10
Defense: 5
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 21
Obsolete by: None
Helicopters are the Air Cavalry of modern armies. They can attack multiple targets and conquer cities. Unaffected by terrain, they are good for Partisan suppression. They can transport Marines and AAA and are thus well-suited for commando ops.

For each turn not ended in a City, Base, or Carrier, 1hp is lost. +1 move is awarded if starting a turn in a City or Airbase. Whether resting or not, all Helicopter types regain 10hp for each turn-change spent in a city.

Helicopters fly low to avoid Interception. This invites attacks by ground units from Riflemen onward. They are unreachable to Artillery types and get +50% defense vs. foot units. Helicopters can be attacked by Sea from Ironclad onward.
Helicopters can retaliate 3 rounds against Special Unit Attacks.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does. Helicopters can transport one Marines or AAA unit.

‚û§ Belongs to Helicopter unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Can conquer empty enemy cities.
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Unreachable. Artillery, Howitzer, and units prior to Riflemen and Ironclad can't attack this unit.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Prevents enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ +50% defense bonus if attacked by Foot Soldiers or Cavalry.
‚û§ STACK ESCAPE: 60% odds to escape if stack defender loses, if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.
‚û§ Loses 1hp for every turn in the air.
‚û§ Gets +1 move point if starting its turn in a City or Airbase.
‚û§ The first turn spent in a city, all Helicopter types regain 10hp.
‚û§ Can carry 1 Marines or Anti-Aircraft Artillery unit.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo not visible except to allies.
‚û§ Has Special Defense against Special Attacks / Ranged Attacks.
  ‚Ä¢ Gives 3 free rounds of combat against up to 3 units in an enemy stack.
  ‚Ä¢ A maximum of 1 unit can be killed.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can Conquer City
‚û§ Can't be bribed.
‚û§ Can't be sabotaged.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.

Jet Fighter

Cost: 70 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 24
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 7
Defense: 6
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Jet Fighters upgrade the Fighter with improved attack, defense, and range. A Jet Fighter can do a maximum of three attacks per turn.

INTERCEPTOR: the Vigil order lets Jet Fighters auto-attack adjacent Air units if they have better attack odds. This unit with half or more of its moves can Vigil in an airbase, a city, on a Carrier type, or if it has used 8 move points or less.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

‚û§ Belongs to AirProtect unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ INTERCEPTOR: can be given the Vigil order to auto-attack adjacent Air units.
    * can be given if unit has 16 or more move points; OR has half or more moves left and is in an airbase, city, carrier type.
  ‚Ä¢ AIR COVER: Most units who cannot attack this unit also cannot attack other units on the tile.
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Unreachable. Most units cannot attack this one.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ STACK ESCAPE: 60% odds to escape if stack defender loses, if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
‚û§ INTERCEPTED by Fighter types on Vigil: they auto-attack if they have better odds attacking than defending.
‚û§ Can attack against Missile units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Air units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Air_High_Altitude units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against AirProtect units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Unit must be in a City, Airbase, or on a Carrier type after 1 turn.
‚û§ Can Expel Airplane and AWACS.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can't be bribed.
‚û§ Can't be sabotaged.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.

Fighter-types on Vigil will (usually) engage the following units:

* Note: Propeller-type fighters are unable to reach high altitude aircraft (Jet Bomber, Spy Plane.)
Vet levels and hitpoints may alter the decision to engage.

Multi-Fighter

Cost: 90 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 22
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 6
Defense: 7
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Stealth Multi-Fighter
Multi-Fighters are fitted for mission versatility. They are sturdy, defend better, and have two turns of fuel. They are good for escorting bombers, pursuing enemy bombers on long range missions, defensive ground support, naval missions, reconnaissance, and interception. On its first turn of fuel, a Multi-Fighter can vigil at any range, and can do a maximum of two attacks per turn.

INTERCEPTORÔºöthe Vigil order lets Multi-Fighters auto-attack adjacent Air units if they have better attack odds. This unit with half or more of its moves can Vigil in an airbase, a city, on a Carrier type, on its first turn of fuel, or if it has used 8 moves or less.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

‚û§ Belongs to AirProtect unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ INTERCEPTOR: can be given the Vigil order to auto-attack adjacent Air units.
    * can be given if unit has at least 1 fuel remaining; OR has half or more moves left and is in an airbase, city, carrier type.
  ‚Ä¢ AIR COVER: Most units who cannot attack this unit also cannot attack other units on the tile.
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Unreachable. Most units cannot attack this one.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
‚û§ STACK ESCAPE: 60% odds to escape if stack defender loses, if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.
‚û§ Reconnaissance: reports visible enemy movement even if not sentried.
‚û§ INTERCEPTED by Fighter types on Vigil: they auto-attack if they have better odds attacking than defending.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Air units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Air_High_Altitude units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against AirProtect units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Unit must be in a City, Airbase, or on a Carrier type after 1 turn.
‚û§ Can Expel Airplane and AWACS.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can't be bribed.
‚û§ Can't be sabotaged.
‚û§ Can Sentry Always
  ‚Ä¢ Provides sentry intel of foreign unit movements even when not sentried.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.

Ground Strike Fighter

Cost: 80 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 21
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 8
Defense: 5
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Ground Strike Fighters upgrade the Dive Bomber. They cannot block attacks on other units on their tile, nor engage against Fighters. However, like the Dive Bomber, they can interdict ZoC over land tiles. High fuel capacity allows two turns in the air. No unit can stop this unit from attacking surface units on a tile. This unit can attack 3 times per turn and can also do pinpointed surgical strikes to pillage tiles. This aircraft is a specialized niche unit. It is not an interceptor.
Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Unreachable. Most units cannot attack this one.
  ‚ó¶ Doesn't prevent enemy units from attacking other units on its tile.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
  ‚Ä¢ AIRLIFT: Can be airlifted if it has remaining moves.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ IMPOSES Zone of Control on adjacent native tiles.
‚û§ Can safely iPillage: Instant Ground Strike against tile infrastructure.
  ‚Ä¢ 75% odds of success. +5% for each veteran level.
  ‚Ä¢ Destroys 1 selected infrastructural improvement on the tile, instantly.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 3 movement points. May result in Ground Strike Fighter being unable to re-fuel.
‚û§ +33% defense bonus if attacked by Anti-Aircraft Artillery, Mobile SAM, or AEGIS Cruiser.
‚û§ Unblockable: unreachable units can't block its attacks on reachable units.
‚û§ STACK ESCAPE: 60% odds to escape if stack defender loses, if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.
‚û§ May impose a Zone of Control on its adjacent tiles.
‚û§ INTERCEPTED by Fighter types on Vigil: they auto-attack if they have better odds attacking than defending.
‚û§ Can attack against Helicopter units, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can attack against Bomber types and AWACS, which are usually not reachable.
‚û§ Can't attack Fighter, Escort Fighter, Jet Fighter, or Stealth Fighter.
‚û§ Unit must be in a City, Airbase, or on a Carrier type after 2 turns.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can't be bribed.
‚û§ Can't be sabotaged.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.

Jet Bomber

Cost: 145 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 19
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 15
Defense: 1
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Jet Bombers are stratospheric long-range bombers with 3 turns of fuel: they can be airborne for two turn-changes. Their range makes them useful even after Stealth Bombers are available. A Jet Bomber may do a maximum of three attacks per turn. Stratospheric altitude is unreachable to propeller-based Fighters and AAA. Jet Bombers can carpet-bomb, pillaging tiles from the air. May carry three Bombs.

Stack-EscapeÔºö60% odds to evade stack-death if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
GOTO forces layovers on refuel-tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
‚û§ CITY PENALTY: If attacked in a city, firepower is set to 1 and firepower of attacker is doubled.
‚û§ Can attack a maximum of 2 times per turn.
‚û§ Can safely iPillage: Instant Carpet Bomb against tile infrastructure.
  ‚Ä¢ 75% odds of success. +5% for each veteran level.
  ‚Ä¢ Destroys up to 2 random infrastructural improvements on the tile, instantly.
  ‚Ä¢ Odds of hitting targets are calculated separately.
  ‚Ä¢ Uses 3 movement points. May result in Jet Bomber being unable to re-fuel.
‚û§ STACK ESCAPE: 60% odds to escape if stack defender loses, if attacker doesn‚Äôt have more moves than it does.
‚û§ Anti-Air units have bonuses against this unit.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ Can carry and refuel up to 3 Bomb units.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo cannot be loaded except in a city or a base native to this transport.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo not visible except to allies.
‚û§ Field unit: one unhappiness applies even when non-aggressive.
‚û§ INTERCEPTED by Fighter types on Vigil: they auto-attack if they have better odds attacking than defending.

Penetration Bomber

Cost: 155 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield, 1 Unhappy
Moves: 29
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 165
Defense: 20
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
Before Stealth Bombers were engineered, high tech air forces devised a different way to strike and escapeÔºöextreme speed. Penetration Bombers are bombers with a special role: ultrasonic strike missions on deep interior targets. With only 1 turn of fuel, total range is inferior to other bombers. But a top speed of Mach 2 gives a single-turn range of 29 tiles. Top speed is so fast that interceptors only get 5 combat rounds against this unit. Penetration Bombers can Bomb Strike, a targeted instant-Pillage which costs 3 move points. May carry 2 Bombs. Maximum attacks per turnÔºö2.

Stealth Fighter

Cost: 80 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 28
Vision: 3.46 tiles
Attack: 8
Defense: 4
Firepower: 2
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: None
The most advanced Fighter, with improved attack and longer range. Stealth Fighters cannot be seen unless adjacent to an enemy. Stealth evasion gives a 25% bonus against all Anti-Air units, and reduces SAM Batteries down to a smaller 25% bonus. A Stealth Fighter can do 3 attacks per turn.

INTERCEPTOR: the Vigil order lets Stealth Fighters auto-attack adjacent Air units if they have better attack odds. This unit with half or more of its moves can Vigil in an airbase, in a city, on a Carrier type, or if it has used 12 move points or less.

‚û§ Unit must be in a City, Airbase, or on a Carrier type after 2 turns.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ Can't be bribed.
‚û§ Can't be sabotaged.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.

Boat

Cost: 10 shields
Upkeep: 0
Moves: 6
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 0
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Trireme
Boats were used pre-historically for exploration, transport, and interaction with other tribes. They can travel rivers and oceans, but must always stay near shore. Boats can carry one unit and do ancient commerce: building Wonders or setting up Trade Routes. Early bartering may help you advance faster or create relations with ancient neighbors. Boats are better suited for river travel and gain +2 moves when starting their turn on a river. Everyone can see a Boat‚Äôs cargo.

‚û§ Belongs to RiverShip unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Crew Repair: Automatically repairs +1hp of its damage each turn, regardless of movement.
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Gains +2 moves if starting its turn on a river.
‚û§ Veteran wooden ships gain +1 move point.
‚û§ Can help build a Wonder in any non-hostile city.
‚û§ Can carry 1 Land, LandNoKill, LandAirSea, Big Land, or commerce cargo unit.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo not visible except to allies.
‚û§ Must stay next to safe coast.
‚û§ PORT PENALTY: If attacked in a city, firepower is set to 1 and firepower of attacker is doubled.
‚û§ A non-military unit:
  ‚Ä¢ Cannot attack.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't impose martial law.
  ‚Ä¢ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
  ‚Ä¢ Never provokes an auto-attack

  ‚Ä¢ is done to foreign cities 15 or more tiles distant. (Manhattan Distance)
  ‚Ä¢ inactive during War.
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Caravan.
‚û§ Can Help Build Wonder
  ‚Ä¢ is done in friendly cities. Contributes the unit's shield cost to current production
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Boat.
  ‚Ä¢ adds 10 production.
‚û§ Can Upgrade

‚û§ May acquire veteran status.

Trireme

Cost: 20 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 7
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 1
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Galley
Triremes are used for exploration, transport, and Commerce. The entry on Caravan explains what Commerce units may do.

Triremes can enter Deep Ocean, but there is risk: they must end every second turn on river, coastline, or a city‚Äîor else be lost at sea. They can attack and travel on rivers, but cannot attack the shore. Veteran wooden ships gain 1 extra move point.

Like most ancient sea units, when it initiates combat there will be 15 rounds of combat and 15 total hp lost between both units. This may or may not result in a victor. Triremes do not cause unhappiness.

Triremes are well-suited for river travel and gain +2 moves when starting their turn on a river.
GOTO forces layovers on coastal tiles. To override, shift-click goal-tile or move one tile off the refuel spot.

‚û§ Belongs to Trireme unit class.
  ‚Ä¢ Crew Repair: Automatically repairs 10% of its hitpoints each turn, regardless of movement (+1hp)
  ‚Ä¢ Speed is not affected by terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Does not get defense bonuses from terrain.
  ‚Ä¢ Slowed down while damaged.
‚û§ IGNORES Zones of Control.
‚û§ Imposes NO Zone of Control.
  ‚Ä¢ Doesn't prevent enemy cities from working the tile it's on.
‚û§ Gains +2 moves if starting its turn on a river.
‚û§ Veteran wooden ships gain +1 move point.
‚û§ Can enter foreign territory regardless of peace treaty.
‚û§ Can help build a Wonder in any non-hostile city.
‚û§ Unable to attack air units.
‚û§ Can carry 2 Land, LandNoKill, LandAirSea, LandRoad, Big Land, or commerce cargo units.
  ‚Ä¢ Cargo not visible except to allies.
‚û§ Can only attack units on native tiles.
  ‚Ä¢ Battle will last 15 combat rounds, which may or may not result in a victor.
‚û§ PORT PENALTY: If attacked in a city, firepower is set to 1 and firepower of attacker is doubled.
‚û§ Unit must be next to safe coast, in a city or a base after 2 turns.
‚û§ Can Establish Trade Route
  ‚Ä¢ is done to foreign cities 15 or more tiles distant. (Manhattan Distance)
  ‚Ä¢ inactive during War.
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Caravan.
‚û§ Can Help Build Wonder
  ‚Ä¢ is done in friendly cities. Contributes the unit's shield cost to current production
  ‚Ä¢ uses up the Trireme.
  ‚Ä¢ adds 20 production.
‚û§ Can Upgrade
  ‚Ä¢ upgrades to Galley or, when possible, to the unit type it upgrades to.
‚û§ Attacking with fractional move points gives fractional attack power.
‚û§ May acquire veteran status.
  ‚Ä¢ Veterans have increased strength in combat.

Cost: 25 shields

Moves: 6
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 2
Defense: 1
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 10
Obsolete by: Caravel
The Longboat is a warship. It can attack at sea, attack the shore, and carry one land unit. It is useful for ancient sea campaigns. Longboats can travel on rivers. Veteran wooden ships gain 1 extra move point.

Like most early sea units, when it initiates combat there will be 15 rounds of combat and 15 total hp lost between both units. This may or may not result in the loss of one of the units.

‚û§ Unable to attack air units.

The Galley is an all-purpose sea unit and upgrades the Trireme. It has decent combat strength, can transport, and is a Commerce unit. The entry on Caravan explains what Commerce units may do. Galleys can attack and travel on rivers, but cannot attack the shore. Galleys do not cause unhappiness. Veteran wooden ships gain 1 extra move point.

Like most early sea units, when it initiates an attack, there will be 15 rounds of combat and 15 total hp lost between both units. This may or may not result in the loss of one of the units.

Caravels can attack and travel on rivers and do shore attacks. As a Commerce unit, the Caravel does not cause unhappiness. Veteran wooden ships gain 1 extra move point.

Like most early sea units, when it initiates an attack, there will be 15 rounds of combat and 15 total hitpoints lost between both units. This may or may not result in the loss of one of the units.

Galleon

Cost: 40 shields
Upkeep: 1 Shield
Moves: 9
Vision: 2.00 tiles
Attack: 2
Defense: 3
Firepower: 1
Hitpoints: 20
Obsolete by: Transport
The Galleon is a heavily armed transport ship that can carry up to 4 units. Galleons can attack and travel on rivers, and also do shore attacks. Galleon crews repair their ship an extra +2hp per turn, regardless of whether it has moved. Although the Galleon is not a Commerce unit, it retains one vestige of the commercial abilities for the ships it upgrades. It can enter Peace waters to deliver commercial cargo, and does not cause unhappiness. Veteran wooden ships gain 1 extra move point.

Like most early sea units, when it initiates combat there will be 15 rounds of combat and 15 total hitpoints lost between both units. This may or may not result in the loss of one of the units.
